intro: Phialanthus guantanamensis, commonly known as the Guantánamo phialanthus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
